isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS, AND BUMPER - WorkStar™ Series Starting March 2007 - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - HOOD

step1.para: Loosen, but do not remove, the two upper bumper bolts and washers from the bumper and mount brackets ( Figure 2).
Remove two lower bolts and washers from the bumper ( Figure 2, Items 1 and 3).
With the aid of an assistant, support the bumper and remove the two upper bolts and washers from the bumper and mount brackets ( Figure 2).
Remove the bumper ( Figure 2, Item 1).
Unlatch and open the hood.
Disconnect the headlight harness connectors from both sides of the hood assembly.

warning.para: The hood torsion bars become spring loaded as the hood is closed and are unloaded when the hood is in the open position. Therefore, the hood must be in the open position to remove or install the torsion bars from the hood. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

item.para: Prior to removal, mark each torsion bar to show which side the torsion bars mount on the hood.
The hood wiring harness is secured to the hood hinge rod with wire ties. Remove wire ties as needed to remove the torsion bars.

note.para: Both torsion bars must be removed to remove the hood. Removal of the left torsion bar is shown in this procedure. The right torsion bar must be removed in the same manner.

step1.para: Remove two bolts and the left torsion bar mount plate from the left torsion bar.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Lower Torsion Bar Retainer Bracket

step1.para: Remove the retaining pin and washer from the left torsion bar located at the lower torsion bar retainer bracket.
Slide the left torsion bar out of the lower torsion bar retainer bracket and remove the left torsion bar.
Remove the right torsion bar by using the same steps that were used to remove the left torsion bar.
Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension from the hood stop cables.
Disconnect the hood stop cables by removing the cotter pin from the clevis pin.
Remove the clevis pin from the clevis.
Remove the clevis from the radiator frame and hood stop cable, left and right sides.
Close the hood, but do not fasten latches.
Remove the two bolts and nuts from the hood hinge bracket and the hood hinge rod.

warning.para: The hood is extremely heavy and requires a lifting device with a strap or a minimum of four people to remove or install the hood assembly. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

step1.para: Remove the hood and carefully set it in a secure place to prevent damage to the hood.
To remove D-shaped hood insulators, use an adequate punch to tap insulators free from the hood hinge rod.
To install D-shaped hood insulators, measure and mark the center point of each D-shaped hood insulator.
Using a sharp knife, cut the D-shaped hood insulators on the marked center line.
Insert the D-shaped hood insulators into the hood hinge rod.

warning.para: The hood is extremely heavy and requires a lifting device with a strap or a minimum of four people to remove or install the hood assembly. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

step1.para: Install the hood on the vehicle and align the hood hinge rod and hood hinge bracket holes ( Figure 12, Items 1 and 2).

Install two bolts and nuts on the hood hinge bracket and the hood hinge rod ( Figure 12). The bolts must be installed pointing toward the center of the vehicle. Torque bolts to 35 to 43 lbf-ft (47 to 58 N•m).
Raise the hood to approximately a 45-degree angle and support the hood.
Install the hood stop cables, left and right side, by attaching the clevis and clevis pin to the radiator frame ( Figure 11).
Insert the cotter pin into the clevis pin ( Figure 11, Items 3 and 5).

item.para: The right torsion bar must be installed before the left torsion bar.
Installation procedures for the left and right torsion bars are the same. Figures references show the left torsion bar but the right torsion bar can be installed using the same figures.

step1.para: Install the right torsion bar through the upper torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 2).
Install the right torsion bar through the lower torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 10, Items 1 and 2).
Position the right torsion bar mount plate on the right torsion bar ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 3).
Secure the right torsion bar mount plate with two bolts ( Figure 9, Items 3 and 4). Torque bolts 15 to 18 lbf-ft (20 to 24 N•m).
Secure the right torsion bar to the lower torsion bar retainer bracket with the washer and retaining pin ( Figure 10).
Install the left torsion bar through the upper torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 2).
Install the left torsion bar through the lower torsion bar retainer bracket ( Figure 10, Items 1 and 2).
Position the left torsion bar mount plate on the left torsion bar ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 3).
Secure the left torsion bar mount plate with two bolts ( Figure 9, Items 3 and 4). Torque bolts 15 to 18 lbf-ft (20 to 24 N•m).
Secure the left torsion bar to the torsion bar retainer bracket with the washer and retaining pin ( Figure 10).
Connect the headlight harness connectors on both sides of the hood assembly ( Figure 8).
Secure the hood wire harness with wire ties as needed.

Check hood adjustment and adjust as needed. Refer to
Hood - Adjustment
procedures in this manual.
Align the bumper on the mount brackets.
Install four bolts and washers on the bumper and mount brackets ( Figure 2). Torque bolts to 50 to 55 lbf-ft (68 to 75 N•m).
Close and latch the hood.

svcsubproc.title: Hood - Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: The hood adjustment is made by moving the hood hinge bracket located on the hood hinge vertical support bracket.

step1.para: To adjust the hood left to right:

step2.para: Loosen the hinge mount bolts and slide the hood hinge bracket left or right.
Check the alignment with the hood contour lines. If the hood alignment is proper, tighten the hinge mount bolts. Torque bolts to 50 to 55 lbf-ft (68 to 75 N•m).

step1.para: To adjust hood forward and back:

step2.para: Loosen the hinge mount bolts at the hood hinge bracket.
Slide the hood forward or backward as required.
Check for proper distance between the rear edge of hood and the windshield.
Tighten the hinge mount bolts. Torque bolts to 50 to 55 lbf-ft (68 to 75 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Hood Stop - Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: Adjusting the hood stops on each side of the vehicle allows for a cleaner fit and seal between the hood and cowl tray. Hood height adjustment at the cowl and rear edge of the hood is adjusted by moving the hood stop either up or down.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the hood.
Loosen four bolts on the hood stop mount bracket.
Slide the hood stop mount bracket up or down to adjust the hood.
Tighten four bolts, close the hood and check the hood alignment.
If alignment is correct, torque the bolts to 28 to 35 lbf-ft (38 to 47 N•m).
Close and latch the hood.
Unlatch and open the hood.
Unlatch and open the hood hatch.
Remove four screws, washers, and two hood hatch latches from the hood hatch.
Remove two stud mount screws and washers from the underside of the fender assembly. Remove the hatch latching studs.
Remove four hinge bar mount screws from the hinge bar assembly and remove the hood hatch.
Align the four holes in the hinge bar assembly and hood. Install the four hinge bar mount screws ( Figure 16, Items 3 and 4). Torque to 35 to 44 lbf-in (4 to 5 N•m).
Install the hatch latching studs and secure with the stud mount screws and washers to the underside of the fender assembly ( Figure 16, Items 6 and 7). Torque to 35 to 44 lbf-in (4 to 5 N•m).
Install the hood hatch latches on the hood hatch. Secure with four screws and washers ( Figure 16, Items 1, 2 and 5). Torque to 35 to 44 lbf-in (4 to 5 N•m).
Close and latch the hood hatch.
Close and latch the hood.
